intro: Barbellina, commonly known as the "flowering grass" or "false grass," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Barbellina species are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, where they thrive in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered at the base of the stems. Despite its grass-like appearance, Barbellina is botanically distinct due to its unique floral structure and growth habits.
